contextId.information: The words "to other people" are understood. AT: "you will be a blessing to other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

It is understood that they would swept away with the people of the city. This can be stated in active form. AT: "or else God will destroy you along with the people of the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so you are not swept away

contextId.information: This can be stated with the understood information. AT: "I swear to be as faithful to you and your people as you have been to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

It is understood that the straw and feed are for the camels. You can make clear this understood information. AT: "We have plenty of straw and feed for the camels" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: We have plenty of both straw and feed

contextId.information: The understood information can be stated clearly. AT: "But if you are not prepared to treat my master with family faithfulness and trustworthiness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The word "animals" or "property" is understood. AT: "I have enough animals" (UDB) or "I have enough property" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The missing words may be added. AT: "just as you did when" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "of grain" are understood. AT: "The thin heads of grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It is understood that he sent servants. AT: "He sent his servants to call" or "He sent his servants to summon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It is understood that Pharaoh sent servants. AT: "Pharaoh sent his servants to get Joseph" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "of grain" are understood. AT: "seven heads of grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "of grain" are understood. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:41:07|41:7]]. AT: "The thin heads of grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The word "brother" is understood. AT: "the youngest brother is with our father right now" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the youngest is this day with our father

contextId.information: The word "Canaan" is understood. This information can be made explicit. AT: "The famine was severe in the land of Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: The famine was severe in the land

contextId.information: The word "brother" is understood. AT: "in the youngest brother's sack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: in the sack's opening of the youngest

contextId.information: The word "brother" is understood. AT: "the oldest brother ... the youngest brother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "I will curse" are understood. AT: "and I will curse their fury, for it was cruel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and their fury, for it was cruel
